response.answer_text: Mentally speaking, Billie Eilish is in decent shape in 2019... but for at least two years (2017-18), she was a mess. I've seen some people claiming it was "fake depression" which is LAUGHABLE. It’s true that she was a typical angst-ridden teen going through all the normal depressing crap of being that age... BUT... she had to do it under a giant microscope with half the globe watching. Put yourself in her shoes for a bit. High school peer pressure was bad enough for most people... anyone here reach age 15 and have millions of people criticizing your every move on social media? Now add the pressure of a career where your entire family and dozens of other people (and their families) are counting on your success. And they’re there at work with you and basically part of every minute of your life. If I'm being honest, I'd crumble under that kind of pressure. Hell, I'd have probably grabbed the first million and run away to an island somewhere. Finally add the fact that your childhood is basically gone. You can’t just go hang out with all your old friends. Most of them have become weird and fan-like around you. And you really can’t go ANYWHERE without causing minor stampedes. You travel to all kinds of great cities while touring, but can’t go sightseeing or shopping because fans will literally MOB you. You’ll get hurt… they’ll get hurt… it will be bad. Billie has learned to manage the depression and stress and she's seemingly emerged on the other side in good form. There have been several interviews, starting in the summer of 2019, where she has discussed being in a really good place. She mentioned deleting a lot of the social media stuff from her phone, and cites that as a big part of the improvement in her outlook. She’s also built a small community of friends into a sort of tour entourage, which allows her to have fun while otherwise being a virtual prisoner for weeks at a time.
